Instruction: Halve the avocados, pit them, and scoop the flesh into a bowl. Use a fork to mash the avocado to your desired consistency. Aim for a slightly chunky texture.
Squeeze the lime juice into the mashed avocado and stir to coat evenly. The lime juice helps prevent browning.
Add the finely diced red onion and stir it into the guacamole. You can adjust the amount of onion depending on your preference.
Optional Step: If using a roma tomato, seed it and dice it finely. Add the diced tomato to the guacamole and stir to combine.
Optional Step: If including a kick of spice, seed and mince a ¼ of a jalapeño pepper. Add it to the guacamole and stir to incorporate.
Finely chop the cilantro and add it to the guacamole. Stir everything together until well combined.
Season the guacamole with salt and a pinch of black pepper (optional) to taste. You can adjust the amount of seasonings to your preference.
Serve the guacamole immediately to prevent browning. If not serving right away, you can minimize browning by leaving the pit in the guacamole and pressing plastic wrap directly onto the surface.
Enjoy guacamole with tortilla chips, veggie sticks, or as a topping for tacos, burritos, or salads.
